course_title: Special Topics: Literature: New African Diaspora Literary
class_notes:
(Same as AFS 389 4)
In this course, students will read a wide variety of African women writing from the 20th and 21st centuries across fiction, memoir, poetry and dramatic forms. They will pay attention to the ways that writers such as Ama Ata Aidoo, Lorraine Hansberry, Warsan Shire, Monica Arac de Nyeko, Nawal el Saadawi, Tsitsi Dangarembga, Mariama Ba, etc use their creative work to critique postcolonial nationalism, white supremacy, colonialism, sexism and sexist exploitation in an African continental and diaspora context. Students will write two papers, a shorter one (4 - 5 pages), handed in the middle of the semester, and a longer final paper handed in at the end of the semester (8 - 10 pages).
course_description: Literary topics vary. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
